SEARCH
Module clientSimple
Package com.etiennecollin.tp2.clientSimple

Class Client

java.lang.Object
com.etiennecollin.tp2.clientSimple.Client
public class Client extends Object
The Client class represents a client that can interact with a server through a socket connection.

The client can send registration forms, load courses for a specific semester, and disconnect from the server. The client is run using the static method run(), which connects the client to the server and then allows the user to input commands that are sent to the server. The client uses object input/output streams to communicate with the server.

  • Method Details

    • run

      static void run(int port) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Runs the client, allowing the user to interact with the server.
      Parameters:
      port - The port number of the server to connect to.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the methods listen() or cleanup() throw the exception or when dealing with the client input/output streams.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the method listen() throws the exception.

    • listen

      private static void listen() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Gets the user input command and processes, it if it is valid, before passing it to the server.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the methods register(), getCourses() or disconnect() throw the exception, or if an I/O error occurs when dealing with the client input/output streams.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the methods register() or getCourses() throw the exception.

    • cleanup

      private static void cleanup() throws IOException
      Closes the objectOutputStream, objectInputStream, and client.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when closing the streams or the client socket.

    • register

      private static String register(Scanner scanner) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Sends a registration form to the server.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner which will read the user input.
      Returns:
      The answer from the server.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the method courseSelectionMenu() throws the exception or if an I/O error occurs when dealing with the client input/output streams.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the method courseSelectionMenu() throws the exception or if the returned String by the server is invalid.

    • getCourses

      private static ArrayList<Course> getCourses(String[] command) throws IOException, IllegalArgumentException, ClassNotFoundException
      Sends a command to the server to load available courses with the option to filter for a specific semester.
      Parameters:
      command - The load command and its optional argument.
      Returns:
      A list containing the available courses.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when dealing with the client input/output streams.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the command has an incorrect number of arguments.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the returned Course object by the server is invalid.

    • disconnect

      private static void disconnect() throws IOException
      Disconnects the client from the server by sending a DISCONNECT_COMMAND to the server through the objectOutputStream.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when writing to the objectOutputStream.

    • courseSelectionMenu

      private static Course courseSelectionMenu(Scanner scanner) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Makes the user select an available course.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner used to get user input.
      Returns:
      A valid Course object.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the method getCourses() throws the exception.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the method getCourses() throws the exception.

    • createStudent

      private static Student createStudent(Scanner scanner)
      Creates a student object containing the information about a student.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner which will read the user input.
      Returns:
      A valid student object.
